entry.title: "The goal of any democratic election is to represent the...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

"The goal of any democratic election is to represent the will of the people — not the politicians. To achieve that goal, we must count every single vote otherwise our elections count for nothing. Let’s accept an extended election process and ensure the votes of the American people — all the people — are respected." - ACLU of Colorado Voting Rights Campaign Coordinator Jen Samano

In an unprecedented year, it’s only natural that we have an unprecedented election. While many of us may have wished for the relief of knowing the results on election night, this time it may take d…

denverpost.com

Guest Commentary: Voters decide the winners

In an unprecedented year, it’s only natural that we have an unprecedented election. While many of us may have wished for the relief of knowing the results on election night, this time it may take d…In an unprecedented year, it’s only natural that we have an unprecedented election. While many of us may have wished for the relief of knowing the results on election night, this time it may take d…

entry.title: Once again, Coloradans have made it clear that private medical...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Once again, Coloradans have made it clear that private medical decisions should be made without political interference. There is nothing reasonable about restricting access to essential medical care — not now, not ever. #NoOn115 https://bit.ly/3l3AEQ8

Reproductive rights advocates said Proposition 115 would have been devastating for people seeking abortions in Colorado and around the country.

huffpost.com

Colorado Rejects Ballot Initiative Seeking To Ban Abortion Later In Pregnancy

Reproductive rights advocates said Proposition 115 would have been devastating for people seeking abortions in Colorado and around the country.Reproductive rights advocates said Proposition 115 would have been devastating for people seeking abortions in Colorado and around the country.

entry.title: Coloradans have made it clear, when it comes to picking our...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Coloradans have made it clear, when it comes to picking our country’s president the candidate with the most votes must win. One person should always equal one vote. We all matter.

See the latest updates on the 2020 US Election. See Election Updates

entry.title: ¡Esta elección no terminará hasta que se cuente cada boleta...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

¡Esta elección no terminará hasta que se cuente cada boleta de votante elegible! Esta es una democracia y los votantes deciden el ganador. #CuentenNuestrosVotos

This election won't end until every eligible voter ballot is counted! This is a democracy and the voters decide the winner. #CountOurVotesTranslatedSee the latest updates on the 2020 US Election. See Election Updates

entry.title: Discounting the mail-in vote will disenfranchise voters of color...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Discounting the mail-in vote will disenfranchise voters of color and distort the election outcome.

Count. Every. Vote.
https://www.aclu.org/…/racial-justice-demands-that-every-v…/

See the latest updates on the 2020 US Election. See Election Updates

entry.title: The election isn't over until every vote is counted. This...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

The election isn't over until every vote is counted. This is a democracy and voters decide the winner. #CountEveryVote

See the latest updates on the 2020 US Election. See Election Updates

entry.title: Amendment 76 was brought to Colorado’s ballot by Florida...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Amendment 76 was brought to Colorado’s ballot by Florida politicians who wanted to use Colorado as a guinea pig to give power to an anti-immigrant agenda. Colorado already had a citizenship requirement for voting. Despite this loss, we will continue to work hard to make voting accessible to every citizen. Thank you to everyone who canvassed, made calls, made videos, texted and talked to friends and family about why Amendment 76 was wrong for Colorado. We won’t stop until we rejoin the 48 other states that value voting rights for young people and immigrants. We are not defeated, we simply have more work to do.

Vote No on 76

See our statement at www.votenoon76.com (link in bio)

See the latest updates on the 2020 US Election. See Election Updates

entry.title: Nearly everyone will need to take time to care for themselves, a...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Nearly everyone will need to take time to care for themselves, a newborn baby, or a seriously ill family member at some point, but 4 out of 5 Coloradans don’t have access to paid family and medical leave. Thanks to Proposition 118 passing more Coloradans can finally put their families first without having to risk losing their job.

Yes On 118: Colorado Families First

entry.title: Boulder just became the 7th jurisdiction to win the right to...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Boulder just became the 7th jurisdiction to win the right to counsel for fighting mass evictions. All people — regardless of their circumstances or background — should have access to safe and stable housing. NEWR is key to fighting mass evictions that impact communities of color and women the most. No one should be evicted for being who they are, especially during a pandemic.

entry.title: This was not the first attempt to pass an abortion ban in...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

This was not the first attempt to pass an abortion ban in Colorado and it may not be the last. But we know from experience that the fight for reproductive rights and justice is successful when we stick together. Thanks to all of your efforts, health needs will continue to drive important medical decisions — not politics. Read the full release here: https://bit.ly/38421pE

entry.title: Reminder: Final results will not come in on election night....
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Reminder: Final results will not come in on election night. That’s okay. Processing ballots takes time. The election isn’t over until each eligible voter’s ballot is counted. #CountEveryVote

See the latest updates on the 2020 US Election. See Election Updates

entry.title: Recordatorio: los resultados finales no se recibirán la noche...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Recordatorio: los resultados finales no se recibirán la noche de las elecciones. Procesar las papeletas lleva tiempo. La elección no termina hasta que se cuente la boleta de cada votante elegible. #CuentenCadaVoto

Reminder: Final results will not be received on election night. Processing ballots takes time. The election isn't over until each eligible voter's ballot is counted. #CountCadaVotoTranslatedSee the latest updates on the 2020 US Election. See Election Updates

entry.title: REMINDER: If you're in line to vote, STAY in line. In...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

REMINDER: If you're in line to vote, STAY in line. In Colorado, if you're in line by 7 p.m. you have the right to register to vote and VOTE!

If you have any problems or questions on Election Day, call the Election Protection Hotline at 1-866-OUR-VOTE or 1-888-VE-Y-VOTA.

See the latest updates on the 2020 US Election. See Election Updates

entry.title: RECORDATORIO: Si está en la fila cuando cierran las urnas,...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

RECORDATORIO: Si está en la fila cuando cierran las urnas, MANTÉNGASE en la fila. ¡En Colorado, si está en la fila antes de las 7 p.m. todavía tiene derecho a registrarse para votar y VOTAR!

Reporta la intimidación o otros problemas al 866-OUR-VOTE (866-687-8683) y 888-VA-Y-VOTA (888-839-8682).

REMINDER: If you're in line when the polls close, STAY in line. In Colorado, if you are in line before 7 pm you still have the right to register to vote and VOTE! Report bullying or other issues to 866-OUR-VOTE (866-687-8683) and 888-VA-Y-VOTE (888-839-8682).TranslatedSee the latest updates on the 2020 US Election. See Election Updates

entry.title: ACLU of ColoradoColorado Secretary of State's OfficeToday is the last day to vote! Return your ballot or vote in-person by 7pm tonight!...
entry.content:
ACLU of ColoradoColorado Secretary of State's Office

Today is the last day to vote! Return your ballot or vote in-person by 7pm tonight! Robocalls/texts with incorrect election info have been reported across the c...ountry, though very limited numbers reported in Colorado. Visit http://GoVoteColorado.gov for correct election information. #FactsAreBetter

entry.title: If you think you've encountered voter disinformation...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

If you think you've encountered voter disinformation online, screenshot and report to https://reportdisinfo.org/. Do not reply or share voting misinformation — even if you are debunking. The more engagements, the more users will see it.

Voter disinformation can look like posts or content with false information on deadlines, dates, voting location, and voter eligibility, especially when in an aggressive tone or when threatening prosecution. For more tips on how to best report voter disinformation, visit https://reportdisinfo.org/

See the latest updates on the 2020 US Election. See Election Updates

entry.title: Colorado voters with disabilities, you have the right to access...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Colorado voters with disabilities, you have the right to access in-person accommodations

● Each polling place is required to be accessible to persons with disabilities.
● If you are unable to sign your name, you have the right to vote without signing your name.
● If you are a voter with Visual Impairments, you are entitled to a ballot that your assistive technology can read. ...
● If you cannot read, see, or operate the voting machine because of a disability, you have the right to receive assistance from any individual you choose, or an election official.

For more accommodation info: https://bit.ly/3ezyYeZ

See MoreSee the latest updates on the 2020 US Election. See Election Updates

entry.title: Proposition 115 is intentionally confusing and aims to ban...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Proposition 115 is intentionally confusing and aims to ban abortion later in pregnancy with no exceptions for health or individual circumstances. Read more about one family's heartbreaking story and vote #NoOn115 [

https://aclu-co.org/no-on-115-one-familys-story/
